Traffic restrictions have also been in place around Iskcon temple at Sant Nagar near Amar Colony in South Delhi, Janmashtami Park at Punjabi Bagh near Ring Road and Santoshi Mata Mandir at Hari Nagar in West Delhi.

347.title: CBI raids Delhi Deputy CM Sisodia's residence; he says 'will give full cooperation'
347.article_body: Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Friday raided Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's residence. "CBI has arrived. We are honest, building a future for lakhs of children...whoever does good work is hassled just like this, that is why our country is still not number one," Sisodia tweeted. "Will give full cooperation...so that the truth can come out soon," he added.

348.title: Damage to Europe's largest nuclear plant in Ukraine would be suicide: UN
348.article_body: UN chief António Guterres said he's "gravely concerned" about fighting near Europe's largest nuclear power plant in Ukraine. "Any potential damage to Zaporizhzhia is suicide," Guterres warned during a summit with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan in Lviv. This was the first meeting between Guterres and Zelenskyy since Russia began invading Ukraine.

349.title: Man posing as clerk cheats Pune jail guard to stop her 'transfer'
349.article_body: A man, posing as a clerk at the office of the Additional Director General (ADG) of prisons, cheated a guard at Pune's Yerawada Central Jail of ₹10,000, police said. The fraudster claimed that the guard has been transferred following multiple complaints against her and then cheated her of ₹10,000 by assuring her to stop the transfer order, police added.

350.title: 4 of family killed as van hits stationary vehicle in Ghaziabad
350.article_body: Four members of a family were killed and a 10-year-old girl was injured after a van they were travelling in collided with a stationary vehicle on the Delhi-Meerut Expressway in Ghaziabad on Thursday. SP (Rural) Iraj Raja said that the vehicle is suspected to be a truck and its driver fled from the scene. The deceased include a seven-year-old boy.

351.title: 4-day Grand Nursery Mela inaugurated at Hyderabad's People's Plaza
351.article_body: Telangana Finance and Health Minister Harish Rao inaugurated the four-day-long All India Horticulture, Agriculture and Grand Nursery Mela at Hyderabad's People's Plaza on Thursday. The fair will help people learn about different gardening methods, varied plant collections and trends in terrace gardens among other things. It will be open to the public from 11 am to 9 pm.

352.title: 5 Dadar roads to be shut from 7 am to 11 pm for 'Dahi Handi' today
352.article_body: Five roads in Mumbai's Dadar will be shut for vehicular movement from 7 am till 11 pm for 'Dahi Handi' today. Ranade Road shall be closed for vehicular traffic from Paneri junction to Dadar (west) railway station. De Silva Road shall be closed from Visava hotel and MC Jawale Road shall be closed from Kabutar Khana to railway station.

353.title: Apple warns of flaw that may let hackers take complete control of iPhones, MacBooks
353.article_body: Apple has disclosed security vulnerabilities for iPhones, iPads and MacBooks that could potentially allow attackers to take complete control of these devices. Apple's explanation of the vulnerability means a hacker could get "full admin access" to the device, SocialProof Security CEO said. Apple has also released software updates, with security experts advising users to update affected devices.

354.title: Rahul asks young fan if he'd come for match, fan says 'To hell with school', video viral
354.article_body: A video of Team India captain KL Rahul's interaction with a young fan in Harare has gone viral. The fan can be seen clicking pictures with Rahul, after which Rahul asks him if he'd come for the match. "Of course...To hell with school," the fan responds. Rahul then asks the young fan to not bunk the school.

355.title: BJYM leader booked for derogatory remarks against AIMIM's Owaisi in Hyd
355.article_body: The Hyderabad Police on Thursday booked Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha (BJYM) city in-charge Sai Ram Yadav for allegedly making derogatory remarks against AIMIM leader Asaduddin Owaisi. According to the case filed by Afzalgunj Police, Yadav had made the remarks during an Independence Day programme in Begum Bazar area. A case was registered under sections 341, 188 and 504 of IPC.

356.title: Bilkis Bano's rapists are 'Brahmins, have good sanskaar': BJP MLA
356.article_body: BJP's sitting MLA from Godhra, CK Raulji, has said the 11 men convicted for the rape of Bilkis Bano, who have been released from jail by the Gujarat government, are "Brahmins" and have "good sanskaar". Raulji was one of the two BJP leaders who were part of the Gujarat government panel that unanimously decided to release the rapists.

357.title: Shut your mouth: North Korea to South Korea President over denuclearisation
357.article_body: North Korea leader Kim Jong-un's sister Kim Yo-jong on Friday said South Korea President Yoon Suk-yeol should "shut his mouth" after he said that his country was willing to provide economic aid in return for denuclearisation. She called Yoon "really simple and still childish" to think that he could trade economic cooperation for the North's honour and nuclear weapons.

358.title: Major projects stuck as tree felling permission awaited: Delhi LG to CM
358.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor (LG) VK Saxena has written to CM Arvind Kejriwal stating that several major projects in the national capital are stuck as permission to fell or transplant trees under the Delhi Preservation of Trees of Act, 1994 is awaited. The Tree Officer is required to give his decision within 60 days of receiving the application, LG added.

359.title: Raju Srivastava stable: Wife after Sunil Pal says his brain has stopped working
359.article_body: Raju Srivastava's wife has told news agency PTI that the comedian is stable and the doctors are treating him well. "Raju ji is a fighter and he will come back to be amongst all of us. We need your prayers and wishes," she said. Her statement comes after comedian Sunil Pal said that Srivastava's brain has stopped working.

360.title: Jonah Hill to stop promoting his films due to 20-year struggle with anxiety attacks
360.article_body: Actor-director Jonah Hill has announced that he will no longer participate in promoting his films due to a 20-year struggle with anxiety attacks. "If I made myself sicker by going out there and promoting it, I wouldn’t be acting true to myself or to the film," he said. "I won’t lose my job while working on my anxiety," he added.

361.title: Gyanvapi case plaintiff's husband claims he got threat calls from Pak
361.article_body: Sohan Lal Arya, husband of a plaintiff in Shringar Gauri-Gyanvapi mosque case, filed an FIR in Varanasi alleging that he received threat calls from a Pakistani number. Arya said the caller asked him to withdraw the petition and threatened him with 'sar tan se juda kardenge' (will behead you) warning. "We're...probing if the number [is] really from Pakistan," police said.

362.title: Farmers dump garlic sacks into MP river amid low prices; video viral
362.article_body: A video showing farmers throwing sacks full of garlic into a river in Madhya Pradesh from a bridge has gone viral on social media. Kisan Swaraj Sangathan said the farmers dumped the sacks into Parvati river as they were getting low prices for garlic. "Traders are purchasing garlic [for around ₹1-4/kg]. However, cost of production was...₹30-40/per kg," a farmer said.

363.title: Father wanted me to act, I enjoyed being among musicians: Lucky Ali
363.article_body: Singer Lucky Ali recently reminisced his early days and spoke about how he ran a carpet cleaning business to escape from his father Mehmood's wish to see him become an actor. "My father wanted me to act, but the times had changed drastically. I enjoyed being among musicians way more," Ali said. He added his music resembles India's culture.

364.title: Father got inspired by 'Lord of The Rings' for 'Krrish': Hrithik
364.article_body: Hrithik Roshan has revealed that his superhero franchise 'Krrish' has a relation with the 'Lord of The Rings' (LOTR) films. He said his father Rakesh Roshan, who directed all the films of 'Krrish' franchise, watched all 'LOTR' films and got inspired to expand the 'Koi...Mil Gaya' (2003) universe. Hrithik said "there wouldn't have been any Krrish" without the 'LOTR' films.

365.title: 'Sita Ramam' is a must watch: Venkaiah Naidu on Dulquer's film
365.article_body: Former Vice President Venkaiah Naidu has praised 'Sita Ramam', which stars Dulquer Salmaan, Mrunal Thakur and Rashmika Mandanna in the lead roles. Congratulating the makers, Venkaiah Naidu said it is after a long time that he enjoyed watching a film. He said 'Sita Ramam' unleashes a range of emotions, which makes it a "must watch" for everyone.

366.title: RTO official with assets '650 times higher' than income raided; pics show bungalow, pool
366.article_body: The Economic Offences Wing raided three premises of RTO official Santosh Paul and his wife in MP's Jabalpur. It was found that the couple had assets "650 times higher" than their known sources of income. During the searches, officials found ₹16 lakh in cash and jewellery. Their 10,000 square feet-bungalow also has a swimming pool, jacuzzi and home theatre.

367.title: Class 3 boy allegedly beaten by teacher for ₹250 school fee, dies in UP
367.article_body: A class 3 student died in a hospital on Wednesday after allegedly being beaten by his school teacher in Uttar Pradesh last week. "[He] was [brutally] beaten by his teacher because of school fees of ₹250/month. I had [paid] it online but the master didn't know," the 13-year-old boy's brother said. "His hand was fractured...There was internal bleeding," he added.

368.title: Reports say children aged below 5 to pay for full ticket for train journeys, govt clarifies
368.article_body: After some reports claimed that children aged below five will have to get a ticket for travelling in train, the government stated such reports are misleading. It stated, "[On passengers' demand]...option has been given to them to buy...ticket and book...berth for their under 5-year-old child if they want...If they don't want...separate berth...then it's free...same like it used to be earlier."

369.title: Got 78 texts on iMessage, 80 on WhatsApp: 19-yr-old Raducanu on defeating Serena
369.article_body: US Open 2021 winner Emma Raducanu, who defeated Serena Williams in straight sets in the round of 64 of Cincinnati Masters, said that she received a lot of messages after her victory. She added that she received 78 texts on iMessage and 80 on WhatsApp. "I'm an awful texter. I think I'm known for it," she further said.

370.title: Interior design startup Prolance raises $2 mn in pre-Series A round
370.article_body: Prolance, a software-as-a-service (SaaS) startup for interior designing, raised $2 million in a pre-Series A funding round. Led by Foundamental and Axilor, the round saw participation from Arali Ventures and Force Ventures. Founded in 2020 by Rama Harinath K, Vivek Parasuram, Raghunath Gururajan, Jaisimha Sathyanarayana and Manoj K, the firm helps procure interior design manufacturing materials.

371.title: Turkey cuts key interest rate amid 80% inflation
371.article_body: Turkey's central bank on Thursday cut its key rate from 14% to 13%, citing  the "weakening effects of geopolitical risks". The move comes as the Turkish lira is fast diminishing in value, and year-on-year inflation is at about 80%. The news of the rate cut led to a dip in the Turkish lira's value against the US dollar.

372.title: Jacqueline victim of larger conspiracy: Lawyer as she's named accused in extortion case
372.article_body: After Jacqueline Fernandez was named as an accused in a ₹200 crore money laundering case, her lawyer stated, "The agencies have failed to appreciate that she was cheated and conned...She is a victim of larger criminal conspiracy." "It's not fair to prosecute her with such untrue allegations," he added. She has handed over all the information, her lawyer said.

373.title: Kejriwal distributing 'revdi' to Rohingya refugees: BJP
373.article_body: Continuing the attack on the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), BJP has alleged that Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal was distributing 'revdi' [freebies] to the Rohingya refugees. BJP leader Anurag Thakur said that just for vote bank politics, Kejriwal was ready to compromise on national security. Calling Kejriwal a 'lie minister,' he said that national security is of utmost importance to BJP.

374.title: NIA raids 2 locations in Punjab while probing IED seizure case
374.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) in Punjab searched two locations while probing the case of IED, arms and ammunition seizure from Batrara toll plaza in Haryana's Karnal district. During the raids, electronic devices and empty cartridges were recovered. So far, during the investigation, four people have been arrested after 3 IEDS, and other arms and ammunition were seized.

375.title: Rushdie’s attacker indicted by US grand jury
375.article_body: Hadi Matar, a 24-year-old man from New Jersey, has been indicted for stabbing author Salman Rushdie last week, US county prosecutors said on Thursday. Matar is scheduled to appear at an afternoon court hearing in Chautauqua County. Matar was arrested on August 12 after he stabbed Rushdie multiple times in front of a crowd at Chautauqua Institution.

376.title: Thunderstorms leave 7 dead in France and Italy, dozens injured
376.article_body: At least seven people were killed and dozens were injured as thunderstorms and hurricane-force winds swept across France and Italy on Thursday. The storms generated windspeed of over 220 km/h in some areas, France's weather agency said. The winds uprooted trees in Tuscany, and about 45,000 houses were left without electricity in Corsica.

377.title: Evacuation plan finalised for Noida twin tower demolition, residents to vacate by Aug 28
377.article_body: The evacuation plan for the demolition of the nearly 100-metre-tall twin towers of Supertech in Noida has been finalised. Both the towers will be demolished at 2.30 pm on August 28 following a Supreme Court order. The residents of Emerald Court and ATS Village societies will have to vacate their homes by 7 am on August 28.

378.title: NASA Artemis I Mission to carry toys, mannequins, Alexa to Moon
378.article_body: NASA's Artemis I rocket will take off to the Moon on August 29. The rocket has been reportedly moved to the launch pad for final preparation. While no human crew will travel aboard, the rocket will be carrying three mannequins, toys, Amazon Alexa, etc as a part of a tradition that began in the 1960s of NASA spacecraft bearing mementoes.

379.title: BJP left cows to their own fate amid lumpy skin disease: Surjewala
379.article_body: Senior Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala said that as the lumpy skin disease spreads in Haryana, the BJP has left cows to their own fate. Alleging that all the BJP does is politics in the name of cows, he said the party had just been mute spectators. He added that within a month, 30,000 cows were infected and 200 died.

380.title: Red alert in Odisha as low pressure forms in Bay of Bengal
380.article_body: The Bhubaneswar Meteorological Centre issued a red alert for extremely heavy rainfall in parts of Odisha on Friday, as a new low pressure area formed in the Bay of Bengal. While the red alert was issued for Keonjhar and Mayurbhanj districts, an orange alert was issued for 14 districts, including Cuttack. Yellow warning was issued for seven districts, including Puri.

381.title: Who are the Best Actor and Best Actress nominees at Filmfare Awards 2022?
381.article_body: The Best Actor nominees at Filmfare Awards 2022 are Dhanush (Atrangi Re), Ranveer Singh ('83), Sidharth Malhotra (Shershaah) and Vicky Kaushal (Sardar Udham). Kangana Ranaut (Thalaivii), Kiara Advani (Shershaah), Kriti Sanon (Mimi), Parineeti Chopra (Sandeep Aur Pinky Faraar), Taapsee Pannu (Rashmi Rocket) and Vidya Balan (Sherni) are Best Actress nominees. The event will be held on August 30.

382.title: How many matches will Team India play from 2023 to 2027 and against whom?
382.article_body: As per the men's Future Tours Program for 2023-2027 cycle, India are scheduled to play 38 Tests, 42 ODIs and 61 T20Is. India will face Australia and England the most during the cycle. India will play 10 Tests, six ODIs and 10 T20Is each against the two countries. India will play 21 international matches against New Zealand in the cycle.

383.title: BJP youth wing members throw eggs at Siddaramaiah's car in Kodagu
383.article_body: BJP youth wing members threw eggs and waved black flags at Leader of Opposition and former Chief Minister of Karnataka, Siddaramaiah, in Kodagu. The protest was against Siddaramaiah's statement on the need for the Hindutva activists to put up Veer Savarkar's photograph in a Muslim area in Shivamogga. The protest led to the clashes between Congress and BJP workers.

384.title: AAP releases 2nd list of 9 candidates for Gujarat Assembly polls
384.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Thursday released the second list of nine candidates for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. The party has nominated Raju Karpada from Chotila constituency, Piyush Parmar from Mangrol (Junagadh) and Karsanbhai Karmur from Jamnagar North. Nimisha Khunt, Prakashbhai Contractor and Vikram Sorani have been nominated from Gondal, Choryasi and Wankaner respectively.

385.title: Fintech startup Jar raises $22.6 mn, valuation reaches $300 mn
385.article_body: Fintech startup Jar, an app for savings and investments, has raised $22.6 million in its Series B funding round. The round was led by Tiger Global Management and saw participation from Arkam Ventures, Eximius Ventures, Force Ventures, LetsVenture, Rocketship Venture Capital and WEH Venture, among others. After this funding, the valuation of the one-year-old startup stands at $300 million.

386.title: Men & women are equal in every aspect, change your mindset: Mohan Bhagwat
386.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat at an event said men and women are equal in every aspect barring biological differences. "Men don't need to attempt to uplift women because they are more capable than men...they don't need any guidance," he said. "It's beyond the reach of men to guide them," he added, urging men to change their parochial attitude towards women.

387.title: 40-yr-old vegetable seller held for selling drugs in Odisha's Ganjam
387.article_body: A 40-year-old vegetable seller was arrested in Odisha's Ganjam for allegedly possessing drugs worth over ₹13 lakh, an official said. Acting on a tip-off, Excise personnel raided the vegetable shop of Bhaskar Dora under Golanthara police station area. They seized around 101 grams of brown sugar, 100 grams of opium and a huge amount of marijuana, deputy excise commissioner said.

388.title: Very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
388.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued very heavy rainfall warning for several states for the next few days. Isolated very heavy rainfall is likely over Jharkhand and Odisha on August 20. It is very likely over Madhya Pradesh on August 21 and 22.  Further, east Rajasthan may witness very heavy rainfall on August 21 and 22.

389.title: 40-year-old policeman attacked by inmates in Nashik Central Jail
389.article_body: A 40-year-old policeman, Prabhucharan Nanaji Patil, deployed in Nashik Central Jail was attacked by some inmates who had allegedly changed their barracks without permission on Thursday, an official said. The group of 10-12 prisoners, serving time on murder charges, allegedly attacked the policeman with stones. "He has suffered injuries on his head, limbs and is hospitalised," the official added.

390.title: DOLO-650 makers spent ₹1,000 crore on doctors to prescribe tablet, Supreme Court told
390.article_body: The Federation of Medical and Sales Representatives' Associations of India informed the Supreme Court that CBDT has accused DOLO-650 makers of spending ₹1,000 crore on doctors to prescribe it. It said the makers distributed freebies worth ₹1,000 crore to doctors to prescribe DOLO-650 to ensure higher profit margin as companies can fix price of tablets above 500mg without government regulation.

391.title: Nitish Kumar is like women who change boyfriends any time: BJP leader
391.article_body: BJP National General Secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya on Thursday said that Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar is similar to women in foreign countries who change their boyfriends any time. Vijayvargiya added that it is never known whose hand Kumar may hold or leave. This comes after JD(U) chief Kumar broke ties with BJP and formed an alliance with RJD in Bihar.

392.title: Delhi reports nearly 2,000 new COVID-19 cases & 8 deaths, positivity rate at 9.42%
392.article_body:
Delhi reported 1,964 new COVID-19 cases on Thursday as compared to Wednesday's 1,652
cases, as per data shared by the health department. Eight more people succumbed to the infection in the last 24 hours, while the positivity rate dropped to 9.42% from 9.92% reported the previous day. The national capital now has 6,826 active COVID-19 cases.

393.title: Mahesh Babu-Pooja Hegde film to release in April 2023
393.article_body: The makers of Mahesh Babu's upcoming film, tentatively titled 'SSMB28', have shared the release date of the Trivikram directorial. Production house Haarika & Hassine Creations on Thursday tweeted that the Mahesh Babu film will release on April 28, 2023. They promised it to be a "high-octane entertainer" with Mahesh in a "scintillating massy look". The film also stars Pooja Hedge.

394.title: Anurag wasn't convinced about Pankaj: Mukesh on 'Gangs...' casting
394.article_body: Casting director Mukesh Chhabra said Anurag Kashyap wasn't sure about casting Pankaj Tripathi in 'Gangs of Wasseypur'. Mukesh, who was the casting director of 'Gangs of Wasseypur', said he convinced Anurag to audition Pankaj along with an actor he was keen to cast in the film. He said Anurag found Pankaj's audition "very good" and decided to cast him.

395.title: Today in BJP there are no elections: Subramanian Swamy
395.article_body: Former MP Subramanian Swamy on Thursday criticised the BJP for "no" organisational elections, a day after the party rejigged its parliamentary board. "Today in BJP there are no elections...To every post is nominated a member with the approval of Modi," he tweeted. Meanwhile, BJP sources said it was a party convention that the president nominates members to different positions.

396.title: All options open: RCP Singh on whether he will join BJP
396.article_body: Former national president of JD(U) RCP Singh on Thursday said "all options" are "open" as far as joining a political party was concerned, including an entry into the BJP. Singh denied rumours that he was the BJP's eyes and ears in the JD(U). He went on to criticise Bihar CM Nitish Kumar for switching alliance partners once again.

397.title: Mumbai sees 1,201 new COVID-19 cases, highest since June 30
397.article_body: Mumbai reported 1,201 fresh cases of COVID-19 on Thursday, which is the highest since June 30 when 1,265 infections were recorded. As per Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation, the city also reported two deaths due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, while the number of active cases stood at 5,712. On Wednesday, Mumbai saw 975 new COVID-19 cases and two deaths.

398.title: Judicial custody of Partha Chatterjee, Arpita extended till Aug 31
398.article_body: A Kolkata court on Thursday extended the judicial custody of former West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee and his aide Arpita Mukherjee till August 31. They were arrested last month in connection with a teacher recruitment scam case. Earlier, the Enforcement Directorate recovered cash worth around ₹50 crore, foreign currency, jewellery and gold biscuits from premises allegedly linked to Arpita.

399.title: My wife has illegally kept our minor children in Pakistan, claims producer Mushtaq
399.article_body: Bombay High Court has sought Union government's response to a petition filed by producer Mushtaq Nadiadwala claiming his two minor children have been illegally detained in Pakistan by his wife. The visiting visa granted to his children by Pakistani authorities expired in October 2021, it said. She herself might have been coerced into extending her stay in Pakistan, Mushtaq added.

400.title: Giant sharks bigger than school bus once lived in seas, ate other predators
400.article_body: As per researchers, a giant shark over 50-foot in size from nose to tail roamed the oceans millions of years ago. The megalodon that was bigger than an entire school bus could devour a creature the size of a killer whale in just five bites, they suggested. It had a gaping jaw to help feed on big creatures.

401.title: No bridge to cross river, MP woman tied to tube to reach hospital
401.article_body: A pregnant woman was tied to a rubber tube to cross a river to reach a hospital in MP's Harda district, as the connectivity was disrupted because of heavy rain. The woman's family took the woman across the river on a rubber tube, after which she was taken to the hospital in an ambulance.

402.title: Maharashtra recognises Dahi Handi as sports, Govindas to get insurance cover of ₹10 lakh
402.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Thursday announced that Dahi Handi festival will be recognised under the sports category in the state. He added that 'Govindas' will get jobs under the sports category and an insurance cover of ₹10 lakh will be provided to them. A 'Pro-Dahi Handi' will also be introduced in the state, Shinde said.
